label: 木戸孝允
本: The Meiji Restoration . Stanford University Press . 1972
説明文: (1833-77). Also: Takayuki. Earlier: KATSURA Kogoro. Choshu loyalist; son of official doctor (20 koku); adopted by hirazamurai (150 koku; then 90 koku). Student of Yoshida Shoin. Official posts in Choshu from 1862. With Takasugi Shinsaku, effective leader of Choshu from 1865. Key member of early Meiji government.
